definition: comparative of `well', (comparative of `good') superior to another (of the same class or set or kind) in excellence or quality or desirability or suitability, something superior in quality or condition or effect, to get better
details:
adverb
- comparative of `well'
= example: comparative of `well'
- from a position of superiority or authority
= synonyms: best
adjective
- (comparative of `good') superior to another (of the same class or set or kind) in excellence or quality or desirability or suitability
- changed for the better in health or fitness
= example: changed for the better in health or fitness
- more than half
= example: more than half
- (comparative and superlative of `well') wiser or more advantageous and hence advisable
= synonyms: best
noun
- something superior in quality or condition or effect
= example: something superior in quality or condition or effect
- the superior one of two alternatives
= example: the superior one of two alternatives
- a superior person having claim to precedence
= example: a superior person having claim to precedence
- someone who bets
= synonyms: bettor, wagerer, punter
verb
- to get better
= example: to get better
= synonyms: improve, ameliorate, meliorate
- to improve or make something better
= example: to improve or make something better
= synonyms: amend, improve, ameliorate, meliorate
- to surpass in excellence
= example: to surpass in excellence
